homes_hear_details: North Dakota has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The North Dakota Department of Mineral Resources / Division of Community Services is the designated state entity coordinating with the U.S. Department of Energy.
state_energy_office: North Dakota Division of Community Services

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For North Dakota, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Cass County (Fargo), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $68,100. In Burleigh County (Bismarck), it is approximately $65,700.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For North Dakota, 150% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Cass County (Fargo), 150% AMI for a family of four is approximately $127,700. In Burleigh County (Bismarck), it is approximately $123,200.

net_metering: North Dakota has a net metering law that applies to investor-owned utilities for systems up to 100 kW. Customers receive credit at the retail rate for excess generation. However, implementation varies by utility.

state_tax_credits.name: North Dakota Geothermal, Solar, and Wind Tax Credit
state_tax_credits.amount: Residential installation credit has expired. Previously offered credits for renewable installations; no active state tax credit program for residential solar or wind as of current date.
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Previously covered geothermal, solar, and wind installations
state_tax_credits.details: North Dakota's renewable energy tax credits for residential installations have largely expired. Check with the North Dakota Tax Department for any updated programs.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: North Dakota Division of Community Services
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $7,000 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating system repair or replacement, windows, doors
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level. Administered through community action agencies across North Dakota.

programs.name: Xcel Energy Residential Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $800 for heat pumps, $400 for insulation, $75 for smart thermostats
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency furnaces, central air conditioners, heat pumps, insulation, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR appliances

programs.amount: Up to $500 for high-efficiency furnaces, $200 for water heaters, $50 for smart thermostats
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency natural gas furnaces, water heaters, smart thermostats, insulation

programs.name: Residential Energy Efficiency Rebates
